note.p: Death: May have died in 1728, by which time had reached letter H in his Pharmaco-Botanologia.

Career: Practised in Dundee; a Nonjuror and a Jacobite, he was imprisoned (1715) and sentenced to death (1716), however he was pardoned after Sir Hans Sloane (FRS 1685), Richard Mead (FRS 1703) and others pleaded with the authorities on his behalf; moved to London and then to Boston
Notes: Proposed by Sir Hans Sloane.
